reviews.text: We first stayed at Hotel Erika four years ago when our children were 10 and 11. They declared it to be the best hotel ever so it was with some trepidation that we went back with them as teenagers - would it live up to expectations? I am happy to say that it did.
reviews.title: Something special!

reviews.text: This is a family run hotel and has been owned by the same family for many decades. This gives it a very special and slightly quirky charm. It is a hotel with great personality and for that I readily forgive it a few oddities. The owners are very hands on and quite delightful, they have put together a well trained and very professional staff who make it a pleasure to stay here.
reviews.title: poor service, noisy
Still good but...
reviews.text: The buildings have been extended in different directions over the years which gives the hotel a rather eccentric layout. The family rooms we have stayed in are not huge but perfectly adequate, with sliding doors separating the main bedroom from the living room with its fold out beds. There is one good sized bathroom with a separate toilet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The indoor swimming pool is adored by children as it is a good size and has a water slide. It is also open 24 hours.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The great success on both visits has been the food. The hotel does half board and it is to be highly recommended. There is also a substantial afternoon tea offered in the conservatory. The breakfasts and dinners are superb. Some of the food is buffet but it has been done with great care and thought and is of a very high standard.
reviews.title: Erika stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel with the some of the best staff we have ever had, The resturant with four courses each night is something to look forward to after a busy day ski-ing. Breakfast buffet had everything and more to set us up for a day on the slopes. The rooms are excellent so clean and well appointed. The owners made a real effort to ensure our stay was comfortable, loved the two pools. Will certainly go back.
reviews.title: Best ski hotel in Kitz

reviews.text: We have stayed at this lovely family Hotel many times, it rates as my personal favorite anywhere in the world.

First stayed at this hotel in August 2008, and stayed here again recently on a driving trip from Italy to the UK. It was so nice to meet some of the same folks that we met last year! There's a real warmth to the way you are dealt with by the family who run the hotel.
reviews.title: Return trip - not disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is fantastic, the rooms very nice - we stayed in room 12 - some people have commented about the lack of air-con, true, I think that it would be good for the few weeks where the night temperature goes above 23 - 24, but these nights are quite few and far between!
reviews.title: Very good hotel overall, with a few drawbacks

reviews.text: We went into the Erika unintentionally, as out first choice hotel, the Tiefenbrunner, was overbooked (or so they said.) The overall experience with the Erika was good, although there were some drawbacks, probably the mian one being lack of air conditioning - a problem in the warmer months as it could be very stuffy at night. Also, the rooms have very thin curtains which let the light shine through at 5am! We didn't find noise an issue, as the road traffic dies down considerably in the late evening, but Kitzbuhel has more than its fair share of chuch bells, which peal with relish from early morning to late at night. Sometimes they produce a veritable medley of tunes lasting several minutes!
reviews.title: Very good stay. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was the usual continental fare: cereals, fruit, yoghurt and various cold meats, cheese, sausages, scrambled eggs and bacon that isn't really bacon in the British definition. Tea and coffee were served rapidly and efficiently.
